page.title: 14TRADE
page.content: We have got a paper shop in the village. It is called a paper shop because they provide our newspapers. It is a little shop; it sells pens and rubbers and things for bikes and birthday things like that. When you open and shut the shop door it rings a little bell. The people who serve you are members of the Bell family, they're very nice to speak to. I don't go there very much, my sister passes the shop on her way to the bus stop. She goes to Secondary School in Barton. The fish and chip shop is just up the road from the paper shop. Not very long ago some different people took it over. We have a Post Office where you can buy toys and cards. Next to it there is a shop called "Spar". It is a very big shop and it sells things like washing powder and food.They sell toys but not much meat.
